Posts.Content: Hi was wandering if anyone else has had a spacer inserted after mastectomy and if it caused your breast to swell. I had my surgery in May and a couple of weeks later I went to get it checked as my breast had gotten bigger. They said it was fine and probably just fluid. It has happened again and I'm not sure if it's due to swimming and going to the gym which I just started a couple of weeks ago. It is a lot bigger than the other one. Also I was supposed to go back to hospital for it to be filled up but never ever needed to as it was same size as my other. I find this strange. Any advice would be grateful   Thanks. X
Posts.Title: Spacer making breast swollen

Posts.Content: Thank you, I went to see plastic surgeon yesterday. She thinks it's fluid so have to wait on an appointment for it to be drained. Kerry. X
Posts.Title: Spacer making breast swollen

Posts.Content: Hi Mandy321 I used cold cap all the way through. Mainly for the sake of my kids. They couldn't handle the thought of me not looking like their mum. I got prescribed lorazapam for the night before and the morning of treatment. I don't know if this made me cope with the cold cap better as I found it ok. Worth giving it a try. Good luck.  X
Posts.Title: Breast cancer, hair loss and sheer worry

Posts.Content: I wore a wig when I was going out due to not being able to straighten it. Was winter so also wore a hat sometimes. I got my hair cut but not short. I lost probably about half of it. Now my treatment is finished I bought a messy bun hair piece which I put on and it looks great with my own hair. I wore my hair up a lot before diagnosis so just look the same. Help me cope with what's going on knowing I still look like me apart from the extra weight I'm carrying. X
Posts.Title: Breast cancer, hair loss and sheer worry

Posts.Content: Hi, Just shows you how all the surgeons have different opinions. I was told last week that I couldn't have implants due to still having to have rd. She also told me it wouldn't be advisable to have them at a later date. Therefor I'm having the muscles from my back to make my new breasts as I didn't have enough fat on my stomach. Dreading it. Hope your feeling better soon. X
Posts.Title: Tightness in implant area after radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi andyloo   I'm going in for double mastectomy on Thursday with immediate reconstruction. One from the muscles from my back and the other is getting a spacer in as they don't want to do both at same time. I've been fine until now. Think the nerves are kicking in a bit as I go in tomorrow. Don't like leaving my daughters either. Just keep thinking it's another step forward to getting rid of this horrible disease. I was told to get back fastening bras and extenders. Probably best asking your bn as the surgeons are all different. Was good to read all the tips from everyone that's been through it.  Wishing you all best. X
Posts.Title: Mastectomy on wednesday..any advice/tips?

Posts.Content: Thats good news it's not genetic. I am the opposite. They weren't going to test me because it's not in the family but I asked because I was 41 and it was tnb cancer. Mine was changed from lumpectomy to double mastectomy with reconstruction. Was glad I found out before op and that they agreed to the test. Best wishes  Kerry. X
Posts.Title: Genetics results - No mutation found

Posts.Content: Hi, I'm in the same boat.  Having double mastectomy but not sure if it can be taken from my stomach yet due to C section. I also can't make my mind up whether to have immediate reconstruction or delayed. Want it by at one time but concerned about recovery. I also have still radiotherapy to get but think that just stops me having implants.
Posts.Title: DIEP after C-Sections

Posts.Content: Hi welshie007 It turned out I couldn't get it from my stomach as there wasn't enough. I'm actually recovering in hospital just now after having a double mastectomy on Thursday with immediate reconstruction on one side using the muscle from my back and a spacer in the other as they thought it was too risky to do both at same time. Pleased with results, just means my journey is going to be longer as I will have to wait at least 6 months before I get the next one done. That's good to hear your cancer free. As you say that's more important.  Wishing you all the best. X
Posts.Title: DIEP after C-Sections

Posts.Content: Hi 1BB.  I'm just finished chemo 3 weeks past. I used the cold cap and glad I did. It thinned out a lot but I still have hair. I bought one of those hair pieces that looks like a messy bun to make my own hair look thicker. Because I can't dye mine to cover the greys I spray it with touch up. I wore my hair up in a bun a lot before treatment so was great to feel like my own self.  Good luck in whatever you decide. X
Posts.Title: * * * APRIL Breast cancer chemo club ****

Posts.Content: Hope all goes well for you Emma. I can relate to how you are feeling. Keep me posted. Sending big hugs.  Kerry. X
Posts.Title: New and nervous

Posts.Content: Emmie76 Hi everyone my name is Emma and I'm 41 married with 6 kids although 3 are adults now. I have had a lump in my right armpit directly next to my breast as apposed to deep inside my armpit. I finally went to my appointment with my GP after cancelling 3 previous appointments think the lump would go away. I have been suffering with all over breast pain but no pain in the lump which is about the size of a grape. My GP referred me to the breast clinic and my appointment is Wednesday. Has anyone else here had cancer diagnosed from an armpit/underarm lump? Will I have a biopsy the same day? And how long does it take for the results? And should I insist on a biopsy even if they think the lump isn't suspicious? (I have read too many stories of ladies being told the lump isn't expected to be cancer only to be told after a biopsy that it is indeed cancer). I'm trying not to worry but have a very strange feeling about it and I'm not sure if I've talked myself into believing it's going to be bad news or if this is a genuine 'sense or instinct' that something is very wrong Emma x   Hi  Emma,  I was exactly the same as you. Found a lump under my arm. Unlike yours mine was high up and you could only feel it certain ways I sat. Went to the Dr's and they referred me to the breast clinic. I was in an awful state and couldn't wait so came home and went on line to see if anyone would take me that day for a mammogram and ultrasound private. Mammogram showed cysts but ultrasound showed a slight lump in my breast. I then was referred back to the nhs and had to wait 2 weeks for biopsy. Was the longest 2 weeks ever. Didn't expect to get told it was breast cancer before I even got the biopsy. I thought my world had ended. I have came through all treatment and operations. I don't want to scare you as yours could be nothing but if it is cancer you will get through it. Hope all goes well.  Kerry. X
Posts.Title: New and nervous

Posts.Content: Emmie76 Thank you all so much for the support over the last few days. My news is fabulous and I'm happy to report that after initially reporting to the worst consultant I've ever visited I was sent from his clinic to the breast clinic who took over and did the mammo and ultrasound scan who gave me the all clear. Such lovely nurse and doctor compared to the more morbid one I had to report to first, actually took the time to hear how I ended up there, what I had been feeling and the changes etc. They are 99% certain it's a fatty lump and he was there a good while making sure! Showed my mammo results to me and explained everything, no biopsy needed and I came away feeling a huge weight off my shoulders. Breast pain is still unexplained however. I don't have dense breasts, but I suppose I could be going through menopause. He did say to report to my GP immediately in the future and to keep an eye on myself for any changes. Next time I'll be asking to see a different initial consultant. He was very dismissive, didn't ask about family history or even check my left side.... very naughty. Just a good job I was treated like I was the only patient they had today in the BC. Sorry for the late reply but I had all my crazy lot over for dinner and wine. They had no idea why I was so happy, especially in comparison to what I could've been calling them about! I hope I did the right thing with not having the biopsy? I'm certain that he would've done it should the lump of been suspicious. I feel my mind has been put at rest now anyway. I wish you all lots of love for the future and a fast recovery.   Just seen this. That's great news , I'm so happy for you.
Posts.Title: Test day today!
